attributes.action: Write all laws in Plain English
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that in order for the majority of the people to fully participate in the governance of the country, our laws should be written in a language that the people can readily understand.
attributes.additional_details:
We further believe that the current practice of drafting and presenting laws in Legal English and “Legalese” is detrimental to a truly representative Parliament and the involvement of the people in the government of the country.

We therefore demand that all future laws made in the UK Parliament should be written in Plain English.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of peanut products in cinemas
attributes.background: Going to the cinema can be a traumatic time for many people with a peanut/nut allergy. Spending most of the time looking around to make sure that someone next to you is not about to open a packet of Peanut M&M’s or another product containing peanuts. Families should feel safe in a place of enjoyment
attributes.additional_details:
Peanut allergies affect 1 in 55 children in the UK, why put our children at risk in a place that is suppose to be enjoyable? 
 Every cinema I have visited in the UK so far sells Peanut M&M’s as a film-time snack. Are there not enough other snacks available without the need to sell peanut based products?? 
 Nuts are in the top 3 most common food allergies in the UK to date, and with this allergy being also airborne this causes more of a danger in close public spaces such as cinemas.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for motorbikes to have different coloured headlamps to cars
attributes.background: Driving at night, in heavy traffic or in wet weather it is often difficult to differentiate a motorbike weaving down between lanes from other cars.  If motorbikes had a different coloured headlamp (yellow maybe), drivers, incl. other riders, looking in rear/side view mirrors would better spot them.
attributes.additional_details: I think this would significantly improve road safety by reducing the number of car accidents with motorbikes when they are not seen by drivers joining / changing lanes in heavy traffic.  The headlight colour would obviously need to be one that would afford the bike rider equal visibility.

attributes.action: Impose a safety check on all animal toys
attributes.background: Animals are just seen as pets to most but to many they are like a family member. Children's toys have to pass a safety check so animal toys should have to too. This issue needs addressing urgently.
attributes.additional_details: There's been many pet deaths caused by pet toys. My friends dog nearly died through playing with a dog toy and my dog was playing tug with one of her toys which the inside was sticking out. A very sharp plastic tube is the only way I can describe it held together with a small piece of sellotape hidden under woven rope. This could have caused my dog serious harm.

attributes.action: Start development of a satellite carrier rocket.
attributes.background: During the 1960s a British rocket named Black Arrow was created that was capable of launching payloads into orbit. However, the program was cancelled in order to save money which left the UK the only country to successfully develop and then cancel an indigenous space rocket.
attributes.additional_details:
-Black Arrow was cancelled in order to save cost, however it was a comparatively cheap rocket design.
-All other countries that have successfully developed rocket technologies have continued to develop them further.
-The lack of our own launch system has led us to rely on foreign countries, such as the Russian Soyuz rocket, which we could be prevented from using their equipment if we fall out of favour with their governments.

attributes.action: Remove defensive architecture to help homeless people sleep safely
attributes.background: We undersign our HM Government to make it illegal for businesses and local communities to have defensive architecture on their buildings and benches. This is so that homeless people can have somewhere to sleep safely at night, without being harmed

attributes.action: All EU powers should return to Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland after Brexit
attributes.background: The UK government is saying that they need to reserve some powers after Brexit to protect the UK single market.  But that’s not necessarily true.  What they’re proposing would actually damage the UK and the UK single market.  So I call on the UK to automatically devolve all of these EU powers.
attributes.additional_details: Devolving all these powers would might prevent the break up of the UK.  Whereas, what the UK government is proposing would actually break Britain up.  So I would like to see a cross-party discussion on this.

attributes.action: Let contraceptives be sold over-the-counter
attributes.background: Contraceptives are currently not sold over-the-counter, you have to get a prescription for one. I believe that this should change. Many people require contraceptive pills and other forms of contraception for different reasons, and they have to go through too much hassle. Make pills over the counter!
attributes.additional_details: People need contraceptives. Women and men - regardless of sexuality - need them to stop STIs and unplanned pregnancies. Transgender men who aren't on HRT can use them to stop their periods, and they may have a judgmental family who would treat them harshly if they found out this was why they were getting contraception - especially 13-to-16-year-olds. Making contraceptives over-the-counter will benefit so many people in terms of health and confidentiality, so what are we waiting for?

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Mental illness in the South Asian and Islamic communities
attributes.background: We would like the government to intervene and educate community leaders, to prevent further stigma and abuse received by South Asians and particularly muslims who suffer from mental health issues, which results in mental health abuse, due to lack of intelligence in the subject by those in authority.

attributes.action: Introduce new regulations for the development of Artificial Intelligence.
attributes.background: Artificial Intelligence is intelligent behaviour, exhibited by computers. Currently AI is at a primitive stage, home assistants are starting to play a role in our lives, but what they can do for us is limited. I want to see new regulations, for further development of AI and Machine Learning.
attributes.additional_details:
Many experts, including founder of Microsoft, Bill Gates, and Professor Stephen Hawking, have raised concerns over the development of AI. Many in particular believe that, by 2045, the point of Technological Singularity will occur. This means that, if AI is developed, without regulation, it could surpass human intelligence.

AI is useful at the present time, however, continuing to develop this, without limits, is dangerous. Machines will always make mistakes, let's not become inferior to them.

attributes.action: Ban positive action in organisations and have all candidates treated equally.
attributes.background: Positive action is unfair. For example, a wealthy female will have an advantage over a less affluent male when it comes to recruitment. No organisation should ask for race, religion, gender or sexuality. This is not relevant to the job and results in less effective recruitment UK wide.
attributes.additional_details: Companies and government organisations should be concerned with finding the best, regardless of non-relevant issues such as a persons sexuality. Employers should be blind when it comes to who gets through to assessment centres and interviews. It’s not fair that suddenly every white male is considered as having being born with a silver spoon. It’s also not fair to treat minorities and women as though they need an advantage in the recruitment process as they couldn’t get the job on their merit

attributes.action: Ban nudity on social media
attributes.background: Nudity has a negative affect on society, and vulnerable individuals are pressured into posting provocative images online which will stay there forever. Naked pictures online causes harm to future generations, because children may feel ‘not good enough’ when compared to the images online.
attributes.additional_details: Instagram and YouTube are full of inappropriate material that shouldn’t be uploaded in the first place.

attributes.action: Teach young adults the struggles of owning a house.
attributes.background: I would like for schools and colleges ect, to teach young adults how hard it is to run a property of their own so when it comes to them having their own property rented, bought or shared accommodation they will know what to do when they come to the hurdles without it ending in them becoming homeless
attributes.additional_details: I strongly agree something like this should be taught budgeting, mortgages. Too many people going into the world with no life skills.

attributes.action: Law requiring food chains to show the calories on menus.
attributes.background:
All food-service chains with 20 or more locations must post the number of calories in the food and drink items they sell.
This law should be implemented as it allows the public to count the amount of calories they eat. It can also reduce the chances of obesity.

attributes.action: Ban all advertising boards on the side of motorways.
attributes.background: Drivers are constantly being threatened with prosecution if they use mobile phones, smoke, vape or do anything that distracts them from driving. Motorway advertising is specifically designed to distract drivers. Some of them have animation and can be very bright by using neon type lighting.
attributes.additional_details: It is a central argument of the government that distractions such as mobile phones etc can affect the driving ability of road users. The same evidence and research can be used to argue that advertising boards have the same effect and are therefore dangerous.

attributes.action: Make the sale of Cannabis Seeds Illegal in the UK
attributes.background: It may surprise you that while it is illegal to have anything to do with Cannabis,it is fine to sell Cannabis Seeds.This may seem to you to be"Asking for trouble"and"Clearly stupid, contradictory & sending a mixed message".This is a loophole that allows cultivation to Start and allows gangs to form.
attributes.additional_details: Cannabis causes mental illness and disrupts educational progression. If as a Society we are opposed to it, we should be opposed to it all the way and not leave loopholes open so that "Head Shops" can sell cannabis seeds under the ludicrous pretext that they are doing it for sentimental reasons or for "genetic storage". This is a barefaced lie that puts the health of the Nation at risk.

attributes.action: Adopt unilateral free trade with the whole world.
attributes.background: We call upon the Government to adopt Unilateral Free Trade to reduce import costs to consumers and businesses. This means removing all tariffs on goods and services, reducing non-tariff trade barriers and recognising other countries' technical standards as equivalent unilaterally.
attributes.additional_details:
Unilateral free trade is the most pragmatic and fair trade policy for Britain. End discriminatory, mercantilist policies and embrace UFT to (1) lower input costs for businesses and the poorest consumers; (2) allow negotiators to focus on services agreements; (3) stimulate domestic competition; (4) reduce red-tape; and (6) lead by example to make the moral case for free trade. 

If you are unwilling to show leadership on trade issues, Britain's consumers are more than willing to do so.

attributes.action: Change the British military's standard issue rifle to the C8/L119
attributes.background: The British military's current rifle, the SA80/L85, is completely outclassed by the Colt Canada C8SFW Carbine, with its higher stopping power and rate of fire, already in use by special forces, the Royal Military Police and Royal Marine 43 Commando Fleet Protection Group
attributes.additional_details: Already a proven rifle, the swap would increase the effectiveness of a single infantry soldier in a firefight. The similarities to the US M4 would also allow spare parts to be used between us and our most powerful ally, and allow soldiers to pick up each other's weapons, for whatever reason, and already be used to an extremely similar one.

attributes.action: British Citizens must be subject to UK taxation wherever they live in the world
attributes.background: The current system encourages high-earning individuals to leave the UK for tax purposes. This is not in the national interest.

attributes.action: Make it so any employer has to reply to job applications within a month.
attributes.background: Applying for a job and getting no reply is demoralising and can leave you unmotivated to apply for others. If you get no reply, you’re unsure if your CV is bad or if they’re ignoring your application. Therefore, employers should reply to applications within a certain amount of time.
attributes.additional_details: If you’re told that you’re not accepted, then it will help significantly more than being told nothing, as you can then build on your CV / application technique. But when you’re ignored, then you don’t know what is wrong and when it happens with every job you apply for it can seriously damage motivation to apply for more. Therefore I feel it is a right that an applicant reserves; to get a reply - wether it be a yes or no or simply that the role is now fulfilled.

attributes.action: Give adoption allowance to self employed people
attributes.background:
If you are employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity pay.
If you are employed and adopting a child you are entitled to adoption pay.
If you are self employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity allowance.
If you are self employed and adopting a child you are entitled to NOTHING!!
attributes.additional_details:
Please support people who are self employed and are wanting to provide a loving and stable home for a child in need.
The financial situation is very important in the adoption process as you need to be able to provide for a child emotionally and financially, no adoption allowance can stand in the way of prospective adoptive parents being approved.
Thank you.

attributes.action: Horn honking/sexual slurs shouted out of car windows to women to be an offence.
attributes.background: The majority of women while in public have to endure multiple forms of harassment, from horn honking to misogynistic sexual slurs shouted out of vehicle windows, whether travelling to work or visiting local shops women endure constant verbal harassment. All women should feel safe on our streets.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience has a 20 year old women living on a main road traveling the 30 minute journey to work I receive upwards of 3 vocal forms of sexual harassment I am made to feel like a piece of meat. Why should this injustice which has occurred for generations in our society be accepted. An online form where victims of this behaviour can report offending vehicle registration numbers to the local authority and a sanction procedure should be in place to prevent these acts being committed.

attributes.action: Children who are registered for home education to have mandatory welfare checks.
attributes.background: When a child is removed from the school roll and registered for home education, there is a loss of the safeguarding layer of that child that teachers and schools currently provide. Parents have no legal obligation to let education department visit the home and determine if a suitable environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Children who are home schooled are at risk of becoming hidden children, with the opportunity to identify risks to their welfare in their home environment severely diminished. 
A simple welfare check on a monthly or quarterly basis would be key to preventing these scenarios.

attributes.action: Change the voting system to proportional representation, dump FPTP
attributes.background: Proportional representation means that vote share in the population matches the amount of seats each party gets in an election. First past the post creates a huge disparity between vote share and seats in the House of Commons, with parties receiving millions of votes and just one seat. Details below
attributes.additional_details:
2015 Election:

•Conservatives - 331 seats, 11,334,226 votes (36.9%)

•Labour - 232 seats, 9,347,273 votes (30.4%)

•UKIP - 1 seat, 3,881,099votes (12.6%)

•Liberal Democrats - 8 seats, 2,415,916  votes (7.9%)

•Green Party - 1 seat, 1,57,630 votes (3.8%)


2017 Election:

•Conservatives - 318 seats, 13,636,684 votes (42.4%)

•Labour - 262 seats, 12,877,918 votes (40.0%)

•Lib Dems - 12 seats, 2,371,861 votes (7.4%)

•UKIP - 0 seats, 594,068 votes (1.8%)

bbc.co.uk/news/election/2017/results

attributes.action: Equal rights for boys up to their 18th birthday to receive the HPV vaccine.
attributes.background: Today 24/7/18, the government announced that boys aged 12-13 will receive the HPV vaccine from 2019. While this is great news,   I would like to petition the government to increase the age limit to the same that is offered to girls, up to their 18th birthday.
attributes.additional_details:
A jab that protects against a virus that causes cervical cancer will be given to boys aged 12 to 13 in England. 
The policy decision brings England into line with Scotland and Wales. 
HPV vaccine is already routinely offered to girls of the same age at secondary school and is free up until they turn 18.
Experts and campaigners have been calling for equal access to the jab, which can also guard against oral, throat and anal cancers.

attributes.action: Give the Firemen, the Police, The Emergency Services a National Day.
attributes.background: Recently, I celebrated my daughter's 4 year old birthday. I invited the local Fire crew, then local Police. I was absolutely overwhelmed with their kindness in turning up and taking the time in talking to the little ones, their patience, their absolute dedication to their job.
attributes.additional_details: They all have been through so much lately, and I got to realise, why do we celebrate the army, who rightly protect us (My little girl's father is ex military, bomb disposal), but not these people, who risk their life for us on a daily basis. They deserve our support. So very much. Please do help me giving them the chance to parade, be proud, be cheered, be supported.

attributes.action: No one can become an MP without having worked 15 years in the workplace.
attributes.background: 'Career' politicians do not have experience of our lives in the UK.  The 'workplace' is defined as any job that is not associated with politics.  EG salaried lobbyists and union representatives would not be able to become MPs unless they had also worked in other professions for 15 years.
attributes.additional_details: Too many current politicians take PPE at university, join lobby or other political organisations, then seek a parliamentary seat.  Ambition, rather than vocation, is their motivation; this is not in the national interest.  Parliament lacks expertise in industrial, engineering, and practical areas.  Academics are needed too, but most decisions require life experiences that the majority of MPs do not have.  We need you to work for us, not just further your ambitions, and play power games.

attributes.action: Ensure that AFCS pays out for service injury AND the impact to life and family
attributes.background: Currently AFCS pays out for service related injuries. However it does not take into account the impact on life and that of the family. This change would bring the scheme more in line with civilian personal injury claims.

attributes.action: Allow the disabled access to biodegradable single use plastics in any future ban
attributes.background: There has been a considerable number of concerns raised by the disabled community and allies about the need for single use plastics in their lives. I would like the language of any ban on any single use plastics to include an exemption for biodegradable plastics for the disabled community.

attributes.action: Abolish business rates in favour of sales tax to rejuvenate town centres.
attributes.background: Town centres are dying because of crippling business rates so a sales tax makes sense to reduce burdens on start up businesses.

attributes.action: Require all schools to provide a trouser alternative during summer periods.
attributes.background: All schools should be legally obliged to provide all students with a trouser alternative; although traditionally formal customs be respected, it is ridiculous that many individuals are not provided with alternative uniforms options, such as shorts, during hotter summer periods.
attributes.additional_details: Many schools throughout the country simply do not provide students with uniform alternatives for hotter weather periods, as a result thousands of students find it particularly hard to concentrate are learn effectively during their academic experience. Being forced to overheat due to schools not providing cooler uniform alternatives is patently absurd - as such, all schools most make a summer suitable uniform for their students.

attributes.action: Make Football compulsory for all schools across the UK (Public and State)
attributes.background: Football is the biggest sport in the world with over 1/3rd of England watching the World Cup games that England were involved in. Some children do not get the chance to play football and excel at the sport, public and state schools.
attributes.additional_details: Every pupil deserves the chance to be involved in a team sport, where it is not physical like rugby, which some students do not want to partake in due to fear of injury.

attributes.action: Ban Smart Meters
attributes.background: There have been concerns about their effect on people’s health, along with the way that they could invade your privacy, and in the end they cost way more compared to an old type of meter.

attributes.action: Set a government cap on the price of Fuel
attributes.background: The price of Petrol is getting ridiculous and has gone up everyday for months, it should be capped at £1.00 a litre.

attributes.action: Cap Tax Avoidance - Introduce 1% Minimum Corporation Tax based on Turnover
attributes.background: It is not unreasonable to expect that all companies who wish to participate in the UK economy should be treated fairly and equally under the tax legislation.  The minimum corporation tax rate based on turnover should be the mechanism to ensure that this happens.
attributes.additional_details:
The minimum corporation tax can be collected in advance at the point of sales and/or assessed annually based on reported turnover.   The new tax could easily be extended in the future to include all cypto-currency transactions to ensure the tax compliance.

On average, the FTSE 100 companies’ corporation tax expense to turnover has gone from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years and companies like eBay pay even less with 0.2% of their turnover going to the UK Tax-man!

attributes.action: Increase research and funding into Lyme Diease and co-infections
attributes.background: Lyme Diease and co-infections is a serious infection that isn't being treated correctly by the NICE guidelines please sign this to force the research and funding into this infection and strength the NHS to treat this debilitating Diease
attributes.additional_details: Lyme is becoming more and more reported in the UK and all over the world, case numbers are getting higher. After i become infected i found the treatement given in the UK was not enough and i keep relapsing, because of this ive been forced to go private to get the right treatment we need a cure not symtom management !!

attributes.action: Include awareness of emotional and physical abuse to the national curriculum
attributes.background: We're at a time in our lives and our society where abuse, emotional or physical, is being seen as normal. Children as young as even 10 or some younger are not able to recognise normal behaviour anymore and see abuse of any kind as normal. This needs to stop now, any age it's not acceptable.

attributes.action: Give all carers with SGO the same allowance regardless of income
attributes.background:
Carers with SGOs keep children out of the care system.  Some of us get an allowance, others don't.  
We get deductions from these allowances, yet we do the same as foster carers who get larger allowances. 
We have the additional issues of emotional attatchement to these children.
attributes.additional_details:
We care for children who have a lot of emotional issues,  we keep them out of the care system because we have a heart and love these children as if they were our own. Yet we get penalised for this, some SGO carers get no help bringing these children up and giving them the life every child deserves.
The government should not make deductions to allowances and should make the allowance the same for every carer regardless of income.

attributes.action: Do not ban 'cartoon characters' from 'unhealthy foods'.
attributes.background: MPs on the Health Committee wish to ban cartoon characters on 'unhealthy food' (such as Tony the Tiger & Nestle's Milky Bar Kid). These brand mascots have been around for decades yet obesity rates are only very high now due to bad parenting.
attributes.additional_details: Link to BBC Article - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-44298135

attributes.action: UK residents aged 16 and 17 year olds should be able to vote in referendums.
attributes.background: I think that people in the UK who were 16/17 should be able to vote in referendums. An example of this I think that 16/17 should have been able to vote in the EU referendum and weren't allowed to and leaving the EU will affect those who weren't able to vote in it, me being one of those individuals.

attributes.action: Make Government Funds Available for Victims & Families of Terrorist Attacks
attributes.background:
I was shocked to recently learn that there is ‘No’ financial funding help for victims or their families of terrorist attacks in the U.K. 
In light of the Manchester Arena bombing, and the 22 victims, London Bridge Attack, Westminster Attack, Finsbury Park Attack in 2017 we should be helping.
attributes.additional_details:
Financial Funds need to be made available for victims and their families , and those who have been affected by incidents of terrorism in the United Kingdom. There needs to be a special fund set up to help these people, and their families who need to take time off work, to look after family members, general living expenses, and specialist care.
This is the least we can do as a nation, to help people who need it the most. After experiencing such life affecting atrocities!

attributes.action: Revert the Design & Technology Resistant Materials GCSE to its prior curriculum
attributes.background:
I signed up to make stuff
Now I am learning about cotton
I did not sign up for this

attributes.action: Decriminalise drug possession
attributes.background: People are currently being needlessly prosecuted for consuming drugs. This method has proved innefective in curbing drug use and deaths. By decriminalising drug possession we can save millions of pounds on convictions and invest in harm reduction methods and education as shown effective by Portugal.
attributes.additional_details: As shown by this link https://www.statista.com/chart/10320/drug-deaths-in-europe/ Portugal's system of decriminalisation has resulted in the lowest death rate from drugs if any country in Europe. By decriminalising drug possession users and addicts alike can get help to stop their addiction and use drugs in a safer manner. Moreover, the majority of drug users do not pose a threat to society and their lives are being ruined due to unjust drug laws. We help the disabled, why not drug users?

attributes.action: Make it illegal for freeholders to receive insurance commission over 10%
attributes.background: Landlords and/or their associates receive hidden commission on buildings insurance at the expense of leasehold owners, and this is often grossly excessive.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous Lands Tribunal cases correcting this but this would not be necessary if it was made law.

attributes.action: Give disabled victims of crime funding for support & services to obtain justice!
attributes.background: Disabled people such as those suffering with Autism find dealing with stress and anxiety very difficult, especially when they are victims of crime, it has a huge negative impact on their health, their life both at work and at home as well as their mental well being.
attributes.additional_details: Adequate funding and support should always be available via a bespoke fund for those disabled victims such as autistics or those with mental disabilities ensuring their needs are met to provide the services and support required so the most vulnerable in our society, who struggle to cope with life in general, let alone when they are the victims of crime are not left alone to deal with courts, ombudsman, regulators, MP's, media and police plus all the paperwork and documentation it entails.

attributes.action: Increase British military spending to £65 Billion
attributes.background: The UK’s military spending is way to low with the threats in N.Korea, Syria and Russia we need to increase spending please sign this petition to increase military spending

attributes.action: Make anywhere serving fresh food to be required to provide free tap water.
attributes.background:
I think that any premises serving fresh food should be required to provide tap water and refill reusable water bottles up to 1ltr for free. 
This should include people who aren’t customers.

attributes.action: MPs must have a vote before the UK engages with military action in Libya
attributes.background: Further to previous Middle East conflicts and their outcome, it is imperative that we have a democratic vote by elected MPs on whether the UK should be involved in an escalation of military activity in Libya

attributes.action: Scrap the make taxation digital regulations for all business below £100k profit
attributes.background: The make tax digital regulations deliver no benefits to either HMRC or small business, especially those on cash accounting or low profit business. The additional burden will inevitably close or damage many business', &  the economy so the best solution would be to scrap it before it is too late
attributes.additional_details: The making tax digital regulations are fundamentally flawed and failed to take note of the consultation warnings of the impact they would have on in particular small business's, so instead of running a parallel trial where the uptake would be voluntary they have instead opted for closure of business and damage to the economy. Therefore the only safe solution is to scrap these for low profit business and make it voluntary instead so that those who see benefits can & others continue to file online

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow boys to wear shorts.
attributes.background: Most schools no longer give boys the option to wear shorts except when taking part in physical education however all schools allow girls to wear skirts. This is sexist and should be resolved by requiring schools to allow boys to wear shorts.
